meanings.definition: Too confident; excessively sure of oneself.
meanings.sent1: She felt oversure about passing the test, but ended up failing.
meanings.sent2: He always appears oversure of his abilities, which can be off-putting.
meanings.sent3: Being oversure in a challenging situation can lead to unexpected outcomes.
meanings.sent4: Her oversure attitude was like a fragile glass, easily shattered by reality.
meanings.sent5: The oversure student was humbled by the difficult exam questions.

meanings.definition: To be overly confident or certain.
meanings.sent1: I tend to oversure my decisions, even when I should seek advice.
meanings.sent2: She oversures herself in situations where a bit of doubt could be beneficial.
meanings.sent3: He oversures his predictions, often to his own detriment.
meanings.sent4: The team oversured victory, only to be defeated in the final moments.
meanings.sent5: Oversuring the outcome without considering risks can lead to failure.
